   19: %%
   20: -module(gen_tcp_echo_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: 
   24: %%-compile(export_all).
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   28: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   29: 	 active_echo/1, passive_echo/1, active_once_echo/1,
   30: 	 slow_active_echo/1, slow_passive_echo/1,
   31: 	 limit_active_echo/1, limit_passive_echo/1,
   32: 	 large_limit_active_echo/1, large_limit_passive_echo/1]).
   33: 
   34: -define(TPKT_VRSN, 3).
   35: -define(LINE_LENGTH, 1023). % (default value of gen_tcp option 'recbuf') - 1
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
   39:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
   40: 
   41: all() ->
   42:     case kernel_test_lib:test_inet_backends() of
   43:         true ->
   44:             [{group, inet_backend_inet},
   45:              {group, inet_backend_socket}];
   46:         false ->
   47:             [{group, inet_backend_default}]
   48:     end.
   49: 
   50: groups() ->
   51:     [{inet_backend_default, [{group, read_ahead}, {group, no_read_ahead}]},
   52:      {inet_backend_socket,  [{group, read_ahead}, {group, no_read_ahead}]},
   53:      {inet_backend_inet,    [{group, read_ahead}, {group, no_read_ahead}]},
   54:      %%
   55:      {read_ahead,       [{group, no_delay_send}, {group, delay_send}]},
   56:      {no_read_ahead,    [{group, no_delay_send}, {group, delay_send}]},
   57:      %%
   58:      {no_delay_send,    testcases()},
   59:      {delay_send,       testcases()}].
   60: 
   61: testcases() ->
   62:     [active_echo, passive_echo, active_once_echo,
   63:      slow_active_echo, slow_passive_echo, limit_active_echo,
   64:      limit_passive_echo, large_limit_active_echo,
   65:      large_limit_passive_echo].
   66: 
   67: 
   68: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   72:     ok.
   73: 
   74: 
   75: init_per_group(Name, Config) ->
   76:     case Name of
   77:         inet_backend_default ->
   78:             kernel_test_lib:config_inet_backend(Config, default);
   79:         inet_backend_socket ->
   80:             init_per_group_inet_backend(socket, Config);
   81:         inet_backend_inet ->
   82:             init_per_group_inet_backend(inet, Config);
   83:         %%
   84:         no_read_ahead   -> [{read_ahead, false} | Config];
   85:         delay_send      -> [{delay_send, true}  | Config];
   86:         _ -> Config
   87:     end.
   88: 
   89: init_per_group_inet_backend(Backend, Config) ->
   90:     case kernel_test_lib:explicit_inet_backend() of
   91:         true ->
   92:             %% Contradicting kernel variables - skip group
   93:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
   94:         false ->
   95:             kernel_test_lib:config_inet_backend(Config, Backend)
   96:     end.
   97: 
   98: end_per_group(Name, Config) ->
   99:     case Name of
  100:         no_read_ahead   -> lists:keydelete(read_ahead, 1, Config);
  101:         delay_send      -> lists:keydelete(delay_send, 1, Config);
  102:         _ -> Config
  103:     end.
  104: 
  105: 
  106: init_per_testcase(Name, Config) ->
  107:     _ =
  108:         case Name of
  109:             slow_active_echo    -> ct:timetrap({minutes, 5});
  110:             slow_passive_echo   -> ct:timetrap({minutes, 5});
  111:             _ -> ok
  112:         end,
  113:     Config.
  114: 
  115: end_per_testcase(_Name, _Config) ->
  116:     ok.
  117: 
  118: 
  119: sockopts(Config) ->
  120:     [Option ||
  121:         {Name, _} = Option <- Config,
  122:         lists:member(Name, [read_ahead, delay_send])].
  123: 
  124: 
  125: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  126: %% to the echo port and receiving them again (socket in active mode).
  127: active_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  128:     echo_test(Config, [], fun active_echo/4, [{echo, fun echo_server/0}]).
  129: 
  130: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  131: %% to the echo port and receiving them again (socket in passive mode).
  132: passive_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  133:     echo_test(
  134:       Config, [{active, false}], fun passive_echo/4,
  135:       [{echo, fun echo_server/0}]).
  136: 
  137: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  138: %% to the echo port and receiving them again (socket in active once mode).
  139: active_once_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  140:     echo_test(
  141:       Config, [{active, once}], fun active_once_echo/4,
  142:       [{echo, fun echo_server/0}]).
  143: 
  144: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  145: %% to the echo port and receiving them again (socket in active mode).
  146: %% The echo server is a special one that delays between every character.
  147: slow_active_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  148:     echo_test(
  149:       Config, [], fun active_echo/4,
  150:       [slow_echo, {echo, fun slow_echo_server/0}]).
  151: 
  152: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  153: %% to an echo server and receiving them again (socket in passive mode).
  154: %% The echo server is a special one that delays between every character.
  155: slow_passive_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  156:     echo_test(
  157:       Config, [{active, false}], fun passive_echo/4,
  158:       [slow_echo, {echo, fun slow_echo_server/0}]).
  159: 
  160: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  161: %% to the echo port and receiving them again (socket in active mode)
  162: %% with packet_size limitation.
  163: limit_active_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  164:     echo_test(
  165:       Config, [{packet_size, 10}], fun active_echo/4,
  166:       [{packet_size, 10}, {echo, fun echo_server/0}]).
  167: 
  168: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  169: %% to the echo port and receiving them again (socket in passive mode)
  170: %% with packet_size limitation.
  171: limit_passive_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  172:     echo_test(
  173:       Config, [{packet_size, 10},{active, false}], fun passive_echo/4,
  174:       [{packet_size, 10}, {echo, fun echo_server/0}]).
  175: 
  176: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  177: %% to the echo port and receiving them again (socket in active mode)
  178: %% with large packet_size limitation.
  179: large_limit_active_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  180:     echo_test(
  181:       Config, [{packet_size, 10}], fun active_echo/4,
  182:       [{packet_size, (1 bsl 32)-1}, {echo, fun echo_server/0}]).
  183: 
  184: %% Test sending packets of various sizes and various packet types
  185: %% to the echo port and receiving them again (socket in passive mode)
  186: %% with large packet_size limitation.
  187: large_limit_passive_echo(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  188:     echo_test(
  189:       Config, [{packet_size, 10},{active, false}], fun passive_echo/4,
  190:       [{packet_size, (1 bsl 32) -1}, {echo, fun echo_server/0}]).
  191: 
  192: echo_test(Config, SockOpts_0, EchoFun, EchoOpts_0) ->
  193:     SockOpts = SockOpts_0 ++ sockopts(Config),
  194:     ct:log("SockOpts = ~p.", [SockOpts]),
  195:     EchoSrvFun = proplists:get_value(echo, EchoOpts_0),
  196:     {ok, EchoPort} = EchoSrvFun(),
  197:     EchoOpts = [{echo_port, EchoPort}|EchoOpts_0],
  198: 
  199:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, 1}|SockOpts], EchoFun, EchoOpts),
  200:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, 2}|SockOpts], EchoFun, EchoOpts),
  201:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, 4}|SockOpts], EchoFun, EchoOpts),
  202:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, sunrm}|SockOpts], EchoFun, EchoOpts),
  203:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, cdr}|SockOpts], EchoFun,
  204: 		[{type, {cdr, big}}|EchoOpts]),
  205:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, cdr}|SockOpts], EchoFun,
  206: 		[{type, {cdr, little}}|EchoOpts]),
  207:     case lists:keymember(packet_size, 1, SockOpts) of
  208: 	false ->
  209: 	    %% This is cheating, we should test that packet_size
  210: 	    %% also works for line and http.
  211: 	    echo_packet(
  212:               Config, [{packet, line}|SockOpts], EchoFun, EchoOpts),
  213: 	    echo_packet(
  214:               Config, [{packet, http}|SockOpts], EchoFun, EchoOpts),
  215: 	    echo_packet(
  216:               Config, [{packet, http_bin}|SockOpts], EchoFun, EchoOpts);
  217: 
  218: 	true -> ok
  219:     end,
  220:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, tpkt}|SockOpts], EchoFun, EchoOpts),
  221: 
  222:     ShortTag = [16#E0],
  223:     LongTag = [16#1F, 16#83, 16#27],
  224:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, asn1}|SockOpts], EchoFun,
  225: 		[{type, {asn1, short, ShortTag}}|EchoOpts]),
  226:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, asn1}|SockOpts], EchoFun,
  227: 		[{type, {asn1, long, ShortTag}}|EchoOpts]),
  228:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, asn1}|SockOpts], EchoFun,
  229: 		[{type, {asn1, short, LongTag}}|EchoOpts]),
  230:     echo_packet(Config, [{packet, asn1}|SockOpts], EchoFun,
  231: 		[{type, {asn1, long, LongTag}}|EchoOpts]),
  232:     ok.
  233: 
  234: echo_packet(Config, SockOpts, EchoFun, EchoOpts) ->
  235:     Type = case lists:keyfind(type, 1, EchoOpts) of
  236: 	       {_, T} ->
  237: 		   T;
  238: 	       false ->
  239: 		   {_, T} = lists:keyfind(packet, 1, SockOpts),
  240: 		   T
  241: 	   end,
  242: 
  243:     %% Connect to the echo server.
  244:     EchoPort = proplists:get_value(echo_port, EchoOpts),
  245:     {ok, Echo} =
  246:         kernel_test_lib:connect(Config, localhost, EchoPort, SockOpts),
  247: 
  248:     ct:pal("Echo socket: ~w", [Echo]),
  249: 
  250:     SlowEcho = lists:member(slow_echo, EchoOpts),
  251: 
  252:     case Type of
  253: 	http ->
  254: 	    echo_packet_http(Echo, Type, EchoFun);
  255: 	http_bin ->
  256: 	    echo_packet_http(Echo, Type, EchoFun);
  257: 	_ ->
  258: 	    echo_packet0(Echo, Type, EchoFun, SlowEcho, EchoOpts)
  259:     end.
  260: 
  261: echo_packet_http(Echo, Type, EchoFun) ->
  262:     lists:foreach(fun(Uri)-> P1 = http_request(Uri),
  263: 			     EchoFun(Echo, Type, P1, http_reply(P1, Type))
  264: 		  end,
  265: 		  http_uri_variants()),
  266:     P2 = http_response(),
  267:     EchoFun(Echo, Type, P2, http_reply(P2, Type)).
  268: 
  269: echo_packet0(Echo, Type, EchoFun, SlowEcho, EchoOpts) ->
  270:     PacketSize =
  271: 	case lists:keyfind(packet_size, 1, EchoOpts) of
  272: 	    {_,Sz} when Sz < 10 -> Sz;
  273: 	    {_,_} -> 10;
  274: 	    false -> 0
  275: 	end,
  276:     ct:log("echo_packet0[~w] ~p", [self(), PacketSize]),
  277:     %% Echo small packets first.
  278:     echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 0),
  279:     echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 1),
  280:     echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 2),
  281:     echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 3),
  282:     echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 4),
  283:     echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 7),
  284:     if PacketSize =/= 0 ->
  285: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun,
  286: 			 {PacketSize-1, PacketSize}),
  287: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun,
  288: 			 {PacketSize, PacketSize}),
  289: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun,
  290: 			 {PacketSize+1, PacketSize});
  291:        not SlowEcho -> % Go on with bigger packets if not slow echo server.
  292: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 10),
  293: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 13),
  294: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 126),
  295: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 127),
  296: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 128),
  297: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 255),
  298: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 256),
  299: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 1023),
  300: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 3747),
  301: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 32767),
  302: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 32768),
  303: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 65531),
  304: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 65535),
  305: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 65536),
  306: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, 70000),
  307: 	    echo_packet1(Echo, Type, EchoFun, infinite);
  308:        true -> ok
  309:     end,
  310:     PacketSize =:= 0 andalso
  311:         begin
  312:             %% Switch to raw mode and echo one byte 
  313:             ok = inet:setopts(Echo, [{packet, raw}, {active, false}]),
  314:             ok = gen_tcp:send(Echo, <<"$">>),
  315:             case gen_tcp:recv(Echo, 1) of
  316:                 {ok, <<"$">>} -> ok;
  317:                 {ok, "$"} -> ok
  318:             end
  319:         end,
  320:     _CloseResult = gen_tcp:close(Echo),
  321:     ct:log("echo_packet0[~w] close: ~p", [self(), _CloseResult]),
  322:     ok.
  323: 
  324: echo_packet1(EchoSock, Type, EchoFun, Size) ->
  325:     case packet(Size, Type) of
  326: 	false ->
  327: 	    ok;
  328: 	Packet ->
  329: 	    ct:log("Type ~p, size ~p, time ~p",
  330: 		      [Type, Size, time()]),
  331: 	    case EchoFun(EchoSock, Type, Packet, [Packet]) of
  332: 		ok ->
  333: 		    case Size of
  334: 			{N, Max} when N > Max ->
  335: 			    ct:fail(
  336: 			      {packet_through, {N, Max}});
  337: 			_ -> ok
  338: 		    end;
  339: 		{error, emsgsize} ->
  340: 		    case Size of
  341: 			{N, Max} when N > Max ->
  342: 			    ct:log(" Blocked!");
  343: 			_ ->
  344: 			    ct:fail(
  345: 			      {packet_blocked, Size})
  346: 		    end;
  347: 		Error ->
  348: 		    ct:fail(Error)
  349: 	    end
  350:     end.
  351: 
  352: active_echo(Sock, Type, Packet, PacketEchos) ->
  353:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Packet),
  354:     active_recv(Sock, Type, PacketEchos).
  355: 
  356: active_recv(_, _, []) ->
  357:     ok;
  358: active_recv(Sock, Type, [PacketEcho|Tail]) ->
  359:     Tag = case Type of 
  360: 	      http -> http;
  361: 	      http_bin -> http;
  362: 	      _ -> tcp
  363: 	  end,
  364:     receive Recv->Recv end,
  365:     %%ct:log("Active received: ~p\n",[Recv]),
  366:     case Recv of
  367: 	{Tag, Sock, PacketEcho} ->
  368: 	    active_recv(Sock, Type, Tail);
  369: 	{Tag, Sock, Bad} ->
  370:             ct:log("Packet: ~p", [inet:getopts(Sock, [packet])]),
  371: 	    ct:fail({wrong_data, Bad, PacketEcho});
  372: 	{tcp_error, Sock, Reason} ->
  373: 	    {error, Reason};
  374: 	Other ->
  375:             ct:log("Packet: ~p", [inet:getopts(Sock, [packet])]),
  376: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other, {Tag, Sock, PacketEcho}})
  377:     end.
  378: 
  379: passive_echo(Sock, _Type, Packet, PacketEchos) ->
  380:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Packet),
  381:     passive_recv(Sock, PacketEchos).
  382: 
  383: passive_recv(_, []) ->
  384:     ok;
  385: passive_recv(Sock, [PacketEcho | Tail]) ->
  386:     Recv = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
  387:     %%ct:log("Passive received: ~p\n",[Recv]),
  388:     case Recv of
  389: 	{ok, PacketEcho} ->
  390: 	    passive_recv(Sock, Tail);
  391: 	{ok, Bad} ->
  392: 	    ct:log("Expected: ~p\nGot: ~p\n",[PacketEcho,Bad]),
  393: 	    ct:fail({wrong_data, Bad, PacketEcho});
  394: 	{error,PacketEcho} ->
  395: 	    passive_recv(Sock, Tail); % expected error
  396: 	{error, _}=Error ->
  397: 	    Error;
  398: 	Other ->
  399: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  400:     end.
  401: 
  402: active_once_echo(Sock, Type, Packet, PacketEchos) ->
  403:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Packet),
  404:     active_once_recv(Sock, Type, PacketEchos).
  405: 
  406: active_once_recv(_, _, []) ->
  407:     ok;
  408: active_once_recv(Sock, Type, [PacketEcho | Tail]) ->
  409:     Tag = case Type of
  410: 	      http -> http;
  411: 	      http_bin -> http;
  412: 	      _ -> tcp
  413: 	  end,
  414:     receive
  415: 	{Tag, Sock, PacketEcho} ->
  416: 	    inet:setopts(Sock, [{active, once}]),
  417: 	    active_once_recv(Sock, Type, Tail);
  418: 	{Tag, Sock, Bad} ->
  419:             ct:log("Packet: ~p", [inet:getopts(Sock, [packet])]),
  420: 	    ct:fail({wrong_data, Bad, PacketEcho});
  421: 	{tcp_error, Sock, Reason} ->
  422: 	    {error, Reason};
  423: 	Other ->
  424:             ct:log("Packet: ~p", [inet:getopts(Sock, [packet])]),
  425: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other, {Tag, Sock, PacketEcho}})
  426:     end.
  427: 
  428: %%% Building of random packets.
  429: 
  430: packet(infinite, {asn1, _, Tag}) ->
  431:     Tag++[16#80];
  432: packet(infinite, _) ->
  433:     false;
  434: packet({Size, _RecvLimit}, Type) ->
  435:     packet(Size, Type);
  436: packet(Size, 1) when Size > 255 ->
  437:     false;
  438: packet(Size, 2) when Size > 65535 ->
  439:     false;
  440: packet(Size, {asn1, _, Tag}) when Size < 128 ->
  441:     Tag++[Size|random_packet(Size)];
  442: packet(Size, {asn1, short, Tag}) when Size < 256 ->
  443:     Tag++[16#81, Size|random_packet(Size)];
  444: packet(Size, {asn1, short, Tag}) when Size < 65536 ->
  445:     Tag++[16#82|put_int16(Size, big, random_packet(Size))];
  446: packet(Size, {asn1, _, Tag}) ->
  447:     Tag++[16#84|put_int32(Size, big, random_packet(Size))];
  448: packet(Size, {cdr, Endian}) ->
  449:     [$G, $I, $O, $P,				% magic
  450:      1, 0,					% major minor
  451:      if Endian == big -> 0; true -> 1 end,	% flags: byte order
  452:      0 |					% message type
  453:      put_int32(Size, Endian, random_packet(Size))];
  454: packet(Size, sunrm) ->
  455:     put_int32(Size, big, random_packet(Size));
  456: packet(Size, line) when Size > ?LINE_LENGTH ->
  457:     false;
  458: packet(Size, line) ->
  459:     random_packet(Size, "\n");
  460: packet(Size, tpkt) ->
  461:     HeaderSize = 4,
  462:     PacketSize = HeaderSize + Size,
  463:     if PacketSize < 65536 ->
  464: 	    Header = [?TPKT_VRSN, 0 | put_int16(PacketSize, big)],
  465: 	    HeaderSize = length(Header), % Just to assert cirkular dependency
  466: 	    Header ++ random_packet(Size);
  467:        true ->
  468: 	    false
  469:     end;
  470: packet(Size, _Type) ->
  471:     random_packet(Size).
  472: 
  473: 
  474: 
  475: random_packet(Size) ->
  476:     random_packet(Size, "", random_char()).
  477: 
  478: random_packet(Size, Tail) ->
  479:     random_packet(Size, Tail, random_char()).
  480: 
  481: random_packet(0, Result, _NextChar) ->
  482:     Result;
  483: random_packet(Left, Result, NextChar0) ->
  484:     NextChar =
  485: 	if
  486: 	    NextChar0 >= 126 ->
  487: 		33;
  488: 	    true ->
  489: 		NextChar0+1
  490: 	end,
  491:     random_packet(Left-1, [NextChar0|Result], NextChar).
  492: 
  493: random_char() ->
  494:     random_char("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVXYZ0123456789").
  495: 
  496: random_char(Chars) ->
  497:     lists:nth(uniform(length(Chars)), Chars).
  498: 
  499: uniform(N) ->
  500:     rand:uniform(N).
  501: 
  502: put_int32(X, big, List) ->
  503:     [ (X bsr 24) band 16#ff, 
  504:       (X bsr 16) band 16#ff,
  505:       (X bsr 8) band 16#ff,
  506:       (X) band 16#ff | List ];
  507: put_int32(X, little, List) ->
  508:     [ (X) band 16#ff,
  509:       (X bsr 8) band 16#ff,
  510:       (X bsr 16) band 16#ff,
  511:       (X bsr 24) band 16#ff | List].
  512: 
  513: put_int16(X, ByteOrder) ->
  514:     put_int16(X, ByteOrder, []).
  515: 
  516: put_int16(X, big, List) ->
  517:     [ (X bsr 8) band 16#ff,
  518:       (X) band 16#ff | List ];
  519: put_int16(X, little, List) ->
  520:     [ (X) band 16#ff,
  521:       (X bsr 8) band 16#ff | List ].
  522: 
  523: %%% A normal echo server, for systems that don't have one.
  524: 
  525: echo_server() ->
  526:     Self = self(),
  527:     spawn_link(fun() -> echo_server(Self) end),
  528:     receive
  529: 	{echo_port, Port} ->
  530: 	    {ok, Port}
  531:     end.
  532: 
  533: echo_server(ReplyTo) ->
  534:     {ok, S} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active, false}, binary]),
  535:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(S),
  536:     ReplyTo ! {echo_port, Port},
  537:     echo_server_loop(S).
  538: 
  539: echo_server_loop(Sock) ->
  540:     {ok, E} = gen_tcp:accept(Sock),
  541:     Self = self(),
  542:     spawn_link(fun() -> echoer(E, Self) end),
  543:     echo_server_loop(Sock).
  544: 
  545: echoer(Sock, Parent) ->
  546:     unlink(Parent),
  547:     echoer_loop(Sock).
  548: 
  549: echoer_loop(Sock) ->
  550:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0) of
  551: 	{ok, Data} ->
  552: 	    ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
  553: 	    echoer_loop(Sock);
  554: 	{error, closed} ->
  555: 	    ok
  556:     end.
  557: 
  558: %%% A "slow" echo server, which will echo data with a short delay
  559: %%% between each character.
  560: 
  561: slow_echo_server() ->
  562:     Self = self(),
  563:     spawn_link(fun() -> slow_echo_server(Self) end),
  564:     receive
  565: 	{echo_port, Port} ->
  566: 	    {ok, Port}
  567:     end.
  568: 
  569: slow_echo_server(ReplyTo) ->
  570:     {ok, S} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active, false}, {nodelay, true}]),
  571:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(S),
  572:     ReplyTo ! {echo_port, Port},
  573:     slow_echo_server_loop(S).
  574: 
  575: slow_echo_server_loop(Sock) ->
  576:     {ok, E} = gen_tcp:accept(Sock),
  577:     spawn_link(fun() -> slow_echoer(E, self()) end),
  578:     slow_echo_server_loop(Sock).
  579: 
  580: slow_echoer(Sock, Parent) ->
  581:     unlink(Parent),
  582:     slow_echoer_loop(Sock).
  583: 
  584: slow_echoer_loop(Sock) ->
  585:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0) of
  586: 	{ok, Data} ->
  587: 	    slow_send(Sock, Data),
  588: 	    slow_echoer_loop(Sock);
  589: 	{error, closed} ->
  590: 	    ok
  591:     end.
  592: 
  593: slow_send(Sock, [C|Rest]) ->
  594:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, [C]),
  595:     receive after 1 ->
  596: 		    slow_send(Sock, Rest)
  597: 	    end;
  598: slow_send(_, []) ->
  599:     ok.
  600: 
  601: http_request(Uri) ->
  602:     list_to_binary(["POST ", Uri, <<" HTTP/1.1\r\n"
  603: 				    "Connection: close\r\n"
  604: 				    "Host: localhost:8000\r\n"
  605: 				    "User-Agent: perl post\r\n"
  606: 				    "Content-Length: 4\r\n"
  607: 				    "Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8\r\n"
  608: 				    "Other-Field: with some text\r\n"
  609: 				    "Multi-Line: Once upon a time in a land far far away,\r\n"
  610: 				    " there lived a princess imprisoned in the highest tower\r\n"
  611: 				    " of the most haunted castle.\r\n"
  612: 				    "Invalid line without a colon\r\n"
  613: 				    "\r\n">>]).
  614: 
  615: http_uri_variants() ->
  616:     ["*",
  617:      "http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfcX3986",
  618:      "http://otp.ericsson.se:8000/product/internal/",
  619:      "https://example.com:8042/over/there?name=ferret#nose",
  620:      "ftp://cnn.example.com&story=breaking_news@10.0.0.1/top_story.htm",
  621:      "/some/absolute/path",
  622:      "something_else", "something_else"].
  623: 
  624: http_response() ->
  625:     <<"HTTP/1.0 404 Object Not Found\r\n"
  626:       "Server: inets/4.7.16\r\n"
  627:       "Date: Fri, 04 Jul 2008 17:16:22 GMT\r\n"
  628:       "Content-Type: text/html\r\n"
  629:       "Content-Length: 207\r\n"
  630:       "\r\n">>.
  631: 
  632: http_reply(Bin, Type) ->
  633:     {ok, Line, Rest} = erlang:decode_packet(Type,Bin,[]),
  634:     HType = case Type of
  635: 		http -> httph;
  636: 		http_bin -> httph_bin
  637: 	    end,
  638:     Ret = lists:reverse(http_reply(Rest,[Line],HType)),
  639:     ct:log("HTTP: ~p\n",[Ret]),
  640:     Ret.
  641: 
  642: http_reply(<<>>, Acc, _) ->
  643:     Acc;
  644: http_reply(Bin, Acc, HType) ->
  645:     {ok, Line, Rest} = erlang:decode_packet(HType,Bin,[]),	
  646:     http_reply(Rest, [Line | Acc], HType).
